attributes.action: RENATIONALISE OUR NHS - SEE  ADDITIONAL  INFORMATION   SUPPORTING THIS REQUEST
attributes.additional_details: The NHS MUST be properly funded and adequately staffed. It must be democratically accountable with reinstatement of the duty of the Secretary of State to provide a health service. Private Finance Initiative debts must be dealt with which minimises cost to the taxpayer and where appropriate examine contracts and investigate them for possible fraud. The NHS must be restored to a rational system without funds being diverted away from delivery of care
attributes.background: Revoke all legislation supporting fragmentation, marketisation and outsourcing to restore the NHS to a publicly funded and publicly provided health service capable of delivering universal, comprehensive care to the whole population of the country, free at the point of need.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Ensure continued Universal health cover by legally committing to a minimum spend: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300925

Create a National Health Insurance Tax for the NHS: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313361

Raise the rate of income tax and corporation tax to fund the NHS: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313995

Revoke the Health and Social Care Act 2012 and renationalise the NHS: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300019

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
